website_summaries.verdict: This basic transistor pocket radio may be no-frills, but it offers all that most users will need.
pros: Simple and easy to use with an analogue dial
Built-in speaker can play stations at decent volume
Gets surprisingly good reception considering the low price
cons: The placement of the aerial means it can't stand up on a flat surface

customer_reviews.title: Full disclosure: I am a radio nerd. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I am a radio nerd. I used to fall asleep with a transistor radio under my pillow, fascinated by the chatter from across the country. Since then, radios are made more cheaply I suppose. Never seen one that came close to reception ability of these older models. I've tried radios that claimed they had more crystals, more diodes, more of whatever gives a radio the means to get clear reception from far away stations. Not impressed. Until this one. I live in the middle of nowhere. A real dead zone blocked by mountains. No cell phone service, no radio. Nothing. The Vondior picks up more stations than I ever thought possible. Unbelievable reception from such a small package.
customer_reviews.author: jake nichols

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT radio!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 95 year old Aunt whose transistor (yes I said transitor) radio died after all these years. She is very happy with it. The sound is really good. The knobs are similar to her old radio. I like because it uses 2 AA batteries instead of a 9 volt. It has proved to be a great replacement for her old radio.
customer_reviews.author: Irishgirl21

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this to listen to the commentary at a NASCAR race and a MLB game! Works great! Sound quality is awesome and just takes some fine tuning to get to the correct station. Great Father’s Day gift!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Great reception!
customer_reviews.text: At first aI was worried, it is very light and very old school technology. Reminds me of some from the 60's. The reception is amazing though. I bought this because others had made comments about that. I want to listen to the local minor league baseball team at work. Work is a metal frame building with loads of florescent lights, computers, and electric motors. None of my other radio devices work at all. Crystal clear reception with this radio! Speaker a 5 on fidelity, but an 8.5 on volume. Perfect for what I want it for at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Burhans

customer_reviews.title: Can actually listen to Coast to Coast AM on AM now.
customer_reviews.text: This little AM/FM radio really pulls in the AM! I have an old AM radio I picked up at an antique store that runs off a 9 volt that this one with its two double A’s puts to shame. Wouldn’t be surprised if I actually heard the late Art Bell talking out of it for how distant the stations are that this thing can pull out and make intelligible sense of. Well worth the amazingly low price. And as you can see from the pictures, it even came in a box with reflective impressions that reflected gold which I think demonstrates a sense of pride in what the company is offering.
customer_reviews.author: Yodamazon.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this radio
customer_reviews.text: I really like this radio, its no frills, outstanding reception,uses 2 AA batts, batts last for a long time, better reception than on very similar i purchased 4 yrs. ago, but better reception for hundreds of stations, i use it 4 hrs. a knight listening to coast2coast and the batts last about 6 mo. I am really happy to replace my old one with this, i thought it might have better tech antenna and it does, my description inexpensive, good engineering and long batt. life.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: This little radio is excellent! It has clear reception and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I live in a deep forest, far from the next town and frequently have periods of time when the electricity is off for 24 hours or more. I have had other radios but returned them because they didn't work under the circumstances. This little radio is excellent! It has clear reception and easy to use,, small enough to carry around. I am going to order another for my "flight bag".
customer_reviews.author: Barbie's Bling Shack

customer_reviews.title: Vondior AM/FM Transistor handheld radio
customer_reviews.text: .Awesome transistor radio that doesn't need digital technology! I was looking for a compact AM/FM transistor radio that does not rely on cell signals, internet, or other digital technology. This radio is very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: ADaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: I am happy I purchased this radio. I can't believe the sound, its clear and can get loud if you want it to. I use it primarily for listening to talk radio both AM and FM. If I move from one area to another the radio goes with me in my shirt pocket. The strap is great for hanging it anywhere there is not a safe place to stand the radio. Reception is good. I live in central Florida and I am out in the country. I have not needed to extend the antenna to aide in reception, it does fine on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long, BUT, good news!
customer_reviews.text: We loved it at first. But now, almost 2 months later, it's broken. Won't work at all. No idea why. It just was playing well, then started fuzzing badly, and now it won't even turn on at all, so we threw it away. And yes, we tried several new batteries... BUT... After I posted this review the company responded in less than a day and refunded me 100%! That impressed me. So a very good company to order from. I am reordering one in hopes that it will work better and maybe the first was just faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah N.

customer_reviews.title: Great product..backed by excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Greatest customer service..great product...superior response to any issue. I highly recommend this product..
customer_reviews.author: Former Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: No Reception
customer_reviews.text: Total junk. I bought because the description said "Best Reception" - totally false. I live in an area where all I can get on AM is a 50K watt station and wanted to get more stations.This "radio" couldn't even get the one station I usually get with 20 year old radios. Look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Part of my Emergency Kit
customer_reviews.text: I included my new Vondior pocket radio in my emergency power outage kit. I live in Florida where we sometimes have tropical storms. Before putting the radio in storage, I tested it out. It pulled in many stations on both am and fm bands. It's good to know that I will still be connected when the power and internet fails.
customer_reviews.author: Ken in St Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Good reception.
customer_reviews.text: I work in a downtown building where reception is hard to get. I have this on my desk and unlike others who have foil on their antenna's, this little radio comes in clear!
customer_reviews.author: 4ladyz

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This item worked perfectly for a few weeks. Then, just suddenly stopped working - static only on both AM sand FM. To my knowledge there was no damage, e.g., dropping it or something like that, but it is now completely out of service. Looking for another.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Bitzenhofer

customer_reviews.title: Radio!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother who has physical and mental different-abilities. Yes, I AM one of those people who say 'differently abled rather than disabled. He loves radios so much and the AM/FM ones are his favorite but they are becoming increasingly difficult to find and be quality. He is very hard on his radios as he uses them all day and drops them leading to some getting accidentally run over by his wheelchair which makes having back ups a necessity. Thank you for keeping this product in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Rackley

customer_reviews.title: Great Reception
customer_reviews.text: Small radio with excellent reception on AM. Don’t listen to FM. Plastic versus metal but might be more durable than metal.
customer_reviews.author: Darell L. West

customer_reviews.title: Bottomline spend a few dollars more and get a better quality product that you’ll be happy with.
customer_reviews.text: The radio works fine for about two weeks and then every time you went to try to turn the dial to change the radio station it became so static he that you actually couldn’t listen to it. And then once you did lock on to a radio station it would cut in and cut out very frustrating ended up being a throwaway product don’t waste your money. Unfortunately, I waited too long to try to send it back to get my money back...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Capen

customer_reviews.title: Reception
customer_reviews.text: Not good in reception . Yes love small compact and light but reception is terrible . I put on one station next thing i know not audible.
customer_reviews.author: Dian

customer_reviews.title: Not Satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Reception and battery life not as good as my 20 year old Sony of same size. I ordered it because I thought the reception of a newer radio would be much better than my 20 year old Sony. I'd like to return it but the return date is long gone.
customer_reviews.author: Juddie M. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: i really wanted to like this radio.
customer_reviews.text: i wanted a small transistor radio to take with me on walks around my neighborhood. I live in Pa but listen to N.Y. radio stations. None of the N.Y. stations would come in clearly. I could hear them for a few seconds than they would drift away. I figured all right I will just listen to my local station but they same thing happened. I tried to listen to it in my house with the same result so back it goes. I am really disappointed because they size was perfect. I have a 30 year old Sony transistor radio that is crystal clear always but is just a little to big to talk on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: THE RECEPTION IS BETTER THAN THE RADIO BY MY BED
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT IT TO LISTEN TO K-9 KATIE TALK SHOW. I'M USUALLY NOT HOME WHEN SHE COMES ON AT 4PM ON SUNDAYS. LAST WEEK I HAD TO SHOP AFTER WORKING AND BROUGHT IT INTO THE GROCERY STORE SO I COULD CATCH THE WHOLE SHOW. THE RECEPTION IS BETTER THAN THE RADIO BY MY BED. IT COMES IN GOOD & STRONG. I'M VERY HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE. I WOULD DEFINITELY BUY THIS ONE AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: jdev

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT SERVICE AFTER THE SALE
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for listening to talk radio on AM band. The sound is terrible with numerous pops and crackles that sounded like a bad speaker except for the fact that it pops and crackles through my headphones as well. This is a nice looking little radio of perfect size for me but a horrible disappointment in sound quality. The packing was haphazard and insufficient with this radio in its box rattling around in a much bigger box but with almost no additional packing materials. THE OWNERS ARE PROMPT, FAIR, AND THEIR SERVICE LEVEL IS EXCELLENT.
customer_reviews.author: 4Q2

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t a transistor radio
customer_reviews.text: If you’re buying this because you think your getting an old fashion transistor radio from the good old days then think again. It has a analog dial that changes channel of a DSP computer chip. Don’t get me wrong the radio works but it’s just not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: KeyWestGuy

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality for the following reasons drifting tuner
customer_reviews.text: very poor quality for the following reasons drifting tuner ,very little volume control, battery life very very short a matter of hours. don't buy , it if I could I would give less than one star junk!
customer_reviews.author: ronald dibella

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible radio. It worked great the 1st day then about a week later all I got was static. Changed batteries, still static. I do not recommend this radio at all.
customer_reviews.author: CowboysFan9

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I’ve only had it a short time. In the beginning, I noticed flaws but brushed them off as minor and kept it anyway. (Clarity and alight channel slipping) Now after just 5 months of owning and only a handful of use, the channels slip in and out constantly. Can’t pick up a clear station unless my hand is touching the radio. Once you take your hand off of it, it goes to pure static. Volume also turns station to static when turning up. Extremely disappointed. Expected something that at least plays music for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Will it really last?
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this radio for about a year and a half. But after about that time, it has started to play erratically; it will play for a few minutes and then all I hear is static. When it first started like this, I thought I needed to change the batteries, which I did. But it still plays for a few minutes and it turns to static. If I turn it off for a minute, it will play the station for a few minutes but starts with the static again! I don't know if I've gotten a 'lemon', but I won't be buying this one again!
customer_reviews.author: C. Shriner

customer_reviews.title: Surprised it was plastic (not metal) but good reception
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something inexpensive and small for travel. As the description states, it’s mono, and sounds it. But it has good FM reception in my area. (Less so for AM, but that may be my location.) I was surprised upon opening the box to discover that the case is silver plastic (not metal). The picture looked like metal to me. But the plastic does keep it lightweight (and probably helps keep the cost down), so OK in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Jengaworld

customer_reviews.title: Portable radio with decent sound
customer_reviews.text: This is the very basic old fashioned transistor radio they had in the 60's. It uses 2 AA batteries which last a long time. Dial the tuner for your chosen radio station, either AM or FM. It is quite loud, much louder than a cell phone. It's also lighter than a cell phone. It can be used with ear phones. One thing this radio doesn't have is the hiss & static old radios used to have, even with the antenna down. Sound quality is pretty decent. It can be used when there's no power to keep track of the weather. Every home should have this, considering it's very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: PickyjadeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Reception Particularly AM
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio for my 91 year old mother-in-law who likes to listen to WJR AM 760. We live in a Detroit suburb and unfortunately very few of the low cost radios pick up this Detroit based station without a lot of static or A/C hum. I have a Sony ICF-S10MK2 portable AM/FM radio that performs very well on the AM band but they are not available anymore. This Vondior VX portable performs as well as the Sony. Actually, they seem almost identical. WJR come in very clearly with very low to no background noise once rotated standing vertical for best reception. Great Value!!
customer_reviews.author: lakesaintclair

customer_reviews.title: Good little product, nice to have a very portable little radio with decent sound
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pocket radio, very handy for travel, ballparks, listening to at night, taking anywhere with you. Sound quality may not be Bose quality, but for 20 bucks I don't expect that. What I want is clear sound quality, easy to use volume and station dials, good reception, and good battery life. So far it has all the above. The station dial is a little sensitive so you have to move it slowly or you'll easily overshoot the station frequency you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: MillenniumMike

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for years for a radio that would allow me to listen to my favorite AM radio stations. I bought some models for over $200 and many between one hundred and two hundred dollars. This is a wonderful radio and it works exactly as advertised. I have two Bose units that can't match this. I returned a Crane radio and a Sangien among others. I even bought special antennas but no luck. I'm telling you, this is the real thing. I am going to order one for my neighbor for her birthday. We both like the oldie stations and other fare on AM radio. At last. My quest is over.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: The batteries have lasted a good bit- about two to four hours a day for two months and still going. The sound quality is adequate. It's not good, but what are you expecting for such a small speaker on a sub-twenty dollar radio. The tuner sucks as does the dial knob that controls it. Same goes for the volume control. They're just unresponsive and thick feeling. Works well for talk radio on a strong FM station, but it needs to be a strong signal. the price seems to have increased since I purchased it; would recommend to keep searching and let us know if you find something worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It works..it's loud...but very hard to find a station....it didn't cost much and not worth the effort to return. .
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Like my husband's Sony!
customer_reviews.text: Had had a silver Grundig mini for about 12 years for my bathroom. It eventually became unanle to be turned on with its push button control. This Vondior radio turns on with a knob, the same knob that controls the volume. Altho it is only AM/FM, did I really need SW? No. This radio fills the bill for me -- small radio for my bathroom counter, sound quality a little tinny but we're not listening to symphonic production -- just the morning news. Great radio for the price and same quality as my husband's Sony "twin".
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Decent radio for camping
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, really no better than the radio in your car for reception. I bought this for camping, best to tape some wire to the antenna and run it up high or touch the antenna to metal on your vehicle. Its plastic and feels like it would break if dropped, be careful with the antenna, for tuning it really needs a longer slide for channels, they are so close together it takes some precision knob turning to dial in a specific station. This is not work 20$, should be about 14$ shipped. I will continue to use it and update my review after time.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: come on fish
customer_reviews.text: spouse wanted a radio to use when fishing , (daily if weather cooperates) we have gotten various portables and have not found one that gets decent reception and have spent up to $60.. this one has good audio, he can listen to tunes and news and weather... now we wait for the fish... blame it on the weather -20 just shuts down the fish, so does wind, oh, well... but it is a great radio, small and good reception...
customer_reviews.author: chriso

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Reminds me of a radio I had 50 years ago. Picks up the stations around here and is pocket friendly.Nice to have . I lose power here a lot and I can not have too many battery powered anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and good reception. Good price and fast delivery. Seller sent email to see if all was well with my purchase. I bought it for my go bag with emergency supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: You will love to Use it!
customer_reviews.text: Did not know what to expect to be honest. I must say this is an awesome little radio. Can pick up many many stations with ease. Powerful sound. Took it to the beach, hung it to my umbrella and soaked up the sun listening to some good tunes. You will get an email from the seller with some helpful tips that come in handy. Don't hesitate on this Radio. It will and can come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: good radio
customer_reviews.text: The radio works as designed, its not fancy and shouldn't have to be to be perfect at what it does. Why 4 stars? The box it arrives in gives you a sensation of an Apple product unboxing. It feels like you're receiving quality. (I wouldn't know, not an Apple user, but from what I've heard and seen). Then when you open it, there's the cheap radio you ordered, and the body sorta fits together but not really, and you look back down at the box at what could have been. Save money on the box. You're shipping the product in another box anyway. CHEAP OUT. Put it to the Radio.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Parts don't fit and fall off.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and ease of use however the first one I received the AM-FM switch fell off. Taped it on so I could use it. When the company got my review stating a problem, they immediately wanted to make it right and sent me another one for free. Second one the battery compartment did not fit and kept falling off. So this got taped on too. Great customer service but be prepared for the radios arriving in flawed condition and have a piece or two of tape handy.
customer_reviews.author: Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Very good reception and sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this little radio because I just wanted a small handheld convenient small radio for news and weather. No need Wi-Fi and all that jazz. Just good old fashioned battery powered. It arrived quickly and was working well. The sound quality was very clear. Reception was great and I was loving it until the 3rd day the reception or the radio went silent. I had to play around with the fm am button. The sound came back on but it kept happening. So I'm returning it for a replacement. I hope the next one will be just fine. Otherwise this would have been the good old radio that I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel R

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, something loose and rattling inside.
customer_reviews.text: I would buy the Sony, which is at a comparable price and much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what i wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I have been looking for. I grew up in the 50s and 60s and everyone had a pocket sized transistor radio. If you wanted music, sports, etc., it was your only option unless you stayed home and listened to the family plug-in radio. This is a good unit. Excellent volume range and clear listening. The only time I seemed to get static is when I got it too close to my ipad (within 1-3 inches). I intend to use this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: A blast from the past..
customer_reviews.text: Even the Vondior logo has a nice retro look to it :-) It's a perfect battery powered radio, has a surprisingly loud speaker (the rear grill helps get a little extra oomph from the small speaker). FM and AM reception was clean, tuning was smooth and being able to run on standard AA's makes it perfect for what I wanted- something I could keep handy for emergencies, but also use when working in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: C. Glowacki

customer_reviews.title: Classical music on all night
customer_reviews.text: I share a room in a test home. On the product, my roommate and I have Classical Minnesota Public Radio on all night. I place the in the middle of the eight feet that separates our beds. The sound carries throughout the room. Nurses aides have said that they enjoy our music when they enter to check (Robert has dementia, Alszheimers, and Parkinson's diseases. Dialing to get the desired station is easy and the station stays. The two batteries are long lasting and easy to remove and install. There is nothing I dislike and, thus, I have given five stars in this review. But this radio!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Bieter

customer_reviews.title: good radio for the money
customer_reviews.text: mine came in an open envelope. box was a bit smooshed, but the radio was good. feels and looks very cheap/fragile. tuning knob was crooked but worked. on/off was interesting. I have not seen that type of mechanism in many many years. but it worked. antenna did help pick up my favorite radio station. headset played properly. built in speaker sounds ok. I really have no technical issues. But I have had it only a short time. I do have a cosmetic issue. the sticker they use for the radio stations has bubbles in it. Minor but still annoying. worth the money if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: It is high, it is far, it is.... Impossible to hear!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in NYC where there is ample radio reception from all the stations I listen to. But this radio sounded like I was in the mountains somewhere barely getting a signal. I bought it to try to listen to the Yankee games, but could barely tell what John Sterling and Suzyn Waldman were saying. While some Yankees fans might consider this a feature, not a bug, I'm willing to suffer through their godawful commentary on order to hear the play by play--but this device wouldn't let me do that.
customer_reviews.author: Skibs

customer_reviews.title: A piece of kit that could help you survive during a hurricane
customer_reviews.text: This radio should be part of everyones hurricane kit. We forget that battery operated radios still exist as everything is digital. When the lights went out as Irma arrived we were able to tune into local radio to know what was happening. Thank you for getting the radio to me in such a short space of time. I have loaned it to an elderly friend who still has no power. Anyone living in areas where you loose power should buy one of these and keep it in a safe place. The weather is only going to get worse so be prepared. Buy it as a practical Christmas gift for family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: very cheap.. It belongs as a prize in a box of Cracker Jacks
customer_reviews.author: James R. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Retro radio Storm Kit necessity
customer_reviews.text: After a recent power failure due to a storm, I got out my storm kit and looked for my portable radio to get the latest storm info. This transistor radio works on 2 AA batteries. It is easy to tune - Takes a bit of time to dial in the station you want to listen to (which is normal for this kind of radio). Has an antenna that you extend and move around to get better reception. The sound is crisp and clear. Perfect for the emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: RicC

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this piece of junk. Very disappointed. Do not buy from this company.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little handheld radio
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for working outside and for power outages. It is light, but seems pretty durable. It takes two AA batteries. It has a headphone jack, but I don’t see us needing that. The power, volume and AM/FM switch are clearly marked. It powered right up and I didn’t have any issues getting any stations.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for about a month!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little radio about a month ago. Just FM no AM which I thought odd. I didn’t feel like the hassle of returning it. So for FM it had great sound for about a month. I got top of the line batteries for it. Would listen to it for about three hours a night five days. Then two nights ago it just stopped working. Neither station works. It turns on (red power light goes on then fades) and there’s nothing, except an ocassional high whine. Annoyed. I want my money back or a new radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable little radio with good reception
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a simple radio that works. We like that it is not digital since you can fine tune to pull in stations instead of having to rely on inaccurate presets. Some distant stations we've tried come in more clearly on this little radio than larger digital radios. Nice little radio for emergencies, and small enough to carry with you when you're moving about the house or yard. Seller Vonidor is very good at communicating with customers - quick response. We have purchased multiple times from them and would not hesitate to do so again.
customer_reviews.author: DogWalker

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the size fool you
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the chance to test battery life yet as I just received this but I am giving this 5 stars because it is exactly what I was looking for. It was smaller than I expected but the volume and sound quality was excellent. I wanted to have a battery operated radio to have as we are heading into hurricane season to keep abreast of weather changes should the power go out. I am completely satisfied with this purchase and recommend it, especially if you're not looking for anything fancy.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Eomai

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Terrible reception and features
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest material used. Feels like a kids toy. Terrible reception. Don’t waste your money just to save a few dollars. I was looking for a handheld radio for information during emergency situations. I returned this in 15mins and shelled out the money for a Crane portable....excellent on every feature.... they know what they’re doing. Don’t buy this cheap thing.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: It's budget friendly! uses for your convince.
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio, and i have been trying to come in contact with a convenient easier in handy old school radio. mostly the time I hear the news at all times. I can take it with me anywhere when needed. the volume is good and in reception. Please continue on making this one's " everyone should buy one for weather season, when lights are out due to circumstances. also when outside grilling, and more. It's budget friendly too. thank you and keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: M.Maria Ocas

customer_reviews.title: Little radio, big sound
customer_reviews.text: I do live just outside of Boston, Mass. so there are a lot of strong signals available. That said the sound quality is excellent. I don't have data on battery life yet, so I may add that info if I ever use it for some length of time. (It's meant for stays away from home & my radio that runs on house current.) It seems well constructed, but handling with reasonable caution would only be sensible for this light a unit. I well pleased with the radio & the Vondoir sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Crane

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave it in a hot car.
customer_reviews.text: The volume control is backward, which takes a little getting used to, but my biggest complaint is when I let it sit in a closed car for a while the label with the frequencies, etc melted and folded up. OK it was warm in the car, maybe 120 degrees F. Uncomfortable when I got in, but not that bad. I had an old Sony that road around in that car with me for years without any problem. Sound quality is decent, frequency display is accurate, but don't let it get warm.
customer_reviews.author: SA Mathman

customer_reviews.title: horrible reception, broken antenna
customer_reviews.text: Awful reception for AM and FM even though I live in the middle of Seattle. My car radio got better reception for Seattle station KIRO 97.3 in Canada 90 miles away than this radio gets near downtown Seattle for same station. And then the antenna came off, but reception sucks regardless of antenna. Plus the battery life is about one week listening about 6 hours per day, what a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Symington

customer_reviews.title: Uses only two sold-everywhere AA batteries
customer_reviews.text: Very much like that this very fine, light-weight AM/FM radio that operates using only two AA batteries that are sold everywhere. Got this radio to listen to local news reports during power outages (without sitting in my car listening to my car's radio!). Since power outages are relatively rare where I live, I keep the batteries out of the radio so if the batteries leak, they won't damage the radio. Great AM/FM radio reception. Sound is crisp and clear. Serves as an emergency-news-talk radio for me, not for listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: G. D. Freitas

customer_reviews.title: this radio looks great. i put brand new aa batteries in
customer_reviews.text: this radio looks great. i put brand new aa batteries in. well the reception isn't what i expected. I live about 15 miles from the nearest am station and it don't pull the signal in. The FM is a little better.
customer_reviews.author: rah123

customer_reviews.title: great radio
customer_reviews.text: this radio is value packed! since im an am radio junkie and my car's radio doesnt have good reception this is just the ticket. works great even here in the mountains. remember to turn the radio for am reception and the antennae for fm. they have great customer service and an extra bonus handbook for wilderness survival. they say when you find something you like buy 2. next order to amazon im getting at least 1 more.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Pa.

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 Packaging & Nostalgia 1/10 Reception
customer_reviews.text: This radio wins points for nostalgia on both the radio's design and the packaging in which it came. That said, I wanted this for reception of AM radio for work in more remote areas of San Diego County. The reception is almost non-existent in the remote areas and poor in the metro areas. Not sure how this has received so many positive reviews regarding reception. Unless you need this as a "prop," you should pass on it as a radio.
customer_reviews.author: 4littleloves

customer_reviews.title: A great little product!!  I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.text: I like to drop off to sleep listening to Christian music or sermons from my favorite speakers, so I purchased one of these neat little transistor radios. Am so pleased that the sound quality is excellent for such a small radio!! I am an 86 yr. old widow living in an assisted-living facility and I find that this compact item will be perfect to take into bed with me!!! BTW, it was sent in record time and arrived in excellent condition!! ThANX so much!! Blessings on you and your business!!!
customer_reviews.author: Likky

customer_reviews.title: It's Been A Long Time!
customer_reviews.text: This is the traditional style radio that I had growing up! I purchased this for my mom who is in a long term nursing facility. With no space for a larger, plug in type radio, this little cutie fit the bill! It's very simple to use, nothing computerized that she had to figure out. I am very pleased (and so is she) with this radio, and would order again. I had some questions that the sellers answered promptly, and it arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Debs

customer_reviews.title: Not Even The Quality of Something Disposable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a transistor radio I had for over a decade which performed perfectly until I sat it on top of my fence and it crashed onto some rocks. This radio lasted a few hours before it died on my completely. I thought, perhaps, I got some lemon batteries - nope. This thing was a complete waste of money. 100% garbage.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaAmanda

customer_reviews.title: Strong reception, great volume
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little portable radio. I like to do yard work but always want to keep abreast of news. This great little radio, even without its aerial up, has great sound. I seem to get more stations than my car radio! ( I live in a major metropolitan area.) I highly recommend this terrific, small, simple-tech news and entertainment source. (Don’t know yet about battery life...would seem to depend on quality of battery.)
customer_reviews.author: Lally

customer_reviews.title: Great reception & low cost.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few other portable & desktop radios at a higher price. The others could not catch the few radio stations I listen to. I gave them away. This picks up the particular fm station I want to listen to in my office, which I haven't done since a very old & large tube radio died on me. As for battery life I haven't had it long enough to judge. P.S.: Good battery life also.
customer_reviews.author: Smokin Crow

customer_reviews.title: Small and lightweight, but great reception
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I took the radio out of the box. It is really small and felt somewhat cheap. I was very pleasantly surprised that the reception was far superior to the full sized radio it replaced. Very much worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: NateM

customer_reviews.title: NICE LITTLE RADIO
customer_reviews.text: It looks to be built solidly; nice sound, easy to change channels between FM & AM; haven't used it that much yet so can't say how good battery life is, but so easy to change out batteries. I haven't had one of these in many years and am pleased with it so far. Nice to have something to take into another room if I want some music and I mostly bought it for emergencies. I'd say it's a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Jan

customer_reviews.title: died in 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 5 weeks then suddenly quit receiving while listening to an FM station. Searched for other stations to make sure it wasn't a problem at the station, and nothing but white noise. No reception for any station AM or FM.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Beachy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, I would like to say that this company policy and integrity is wonderful. I was emailed by the owner to verify that the product arrived in working order. I think that is a great way to earn faithful clients. The product arrived in good condition and works well. The volume is good and it has a good range of stations. I do not know anything about the long term durability or battery life but I am sure if I have any issues the company will help to resolve them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DELIGHTFUL!
customer_reviews.text: This little contraption really takes me back to my teenage years when I snuggled in bed with my little transistor radio and the WLS Radio Station out of Chicago! (I lived in Alabama and heard from CHICAGO!) Anyway, I recently purchased this for power outages, as I have them often on my mountaintop. It is a GREAT radio and the sound is crystal clear. LOVE IT! Purchased another one for my sister and she is raving about it also!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Emergency!  Must have in case of an emergency
customer_reviews.text: I was always told it is wise to have a transistor radio to have for access to news....in the case of an emergency and power or internet outages. This little guy has a surprisingly good sound. I keep it in my computer bag so it is with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: RanchyGirl

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY useless
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless. Don't waste your time, money, and your peace of mind. In the middle of the city, with several other radios around me (in my car, my phone, DVD player, alarm clock, etc.), THIS ITEM can not tune in and play one station. Not even one! And it's supposed to work when I go camping or hiking out of town!!! Amazon is not what it used to be. I have been having issues with DVDs, too (ie, they clearly state, in English, a DVD has subtitles. I buy it, when it arrives, it has subtitles for sure but in Spanish!.. )..
customer_reviews.author: Farrokh Fathi

customer_reviews.title: this radio on FM has a clear and loud sound
customer_reviews.text: For $20, this is a very good little radio, but mine has issues. this radio on FM has a clear and loud sound. my radio has something heavy rattling around inside, and the reason I'm returning it is because of the tuning accuracy, the tuning is off-- example: when the red tuning indicator says it's tuned to 101 FM, it's really on 98 FM- that's a quality control issue that was not checked before the radio was shipped. The AM reception doesn't seem too great, but in my city, there are really no AM stations left
customer_reviews.author: BigMike

customer_reviews.title: things I would change
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely swap the Volume dial with the Station Dial. I don't like that the volume is on the left, it doesn't make sense to me and it irks me. Also the antenna only goes up and down from the side/ it doesn't swindle around to go at a diagonal. I assumed it did at first, and almost broke it. It should swivel from the back to front, also annoying. The sound quality is super staticky. I listen a lot on AM and I live in a big city so I feel like there should be less problems with reception.
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for Tiny Radio
customer_reviews.text: Just got these after disappointing performances by two battery operated radios I had randomly purchased in case of emergency. We had the west coast power outages this week and I had to battle the previously purchased radios to get good reception for our local radio station. So I was delighted to open the box of this petite radio, put in just two batteries, and find lots of stations with great reception. My only gripe is that it is not readily apparent if the station guide is on fm or am.
customer_reviews.author: Susan MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: I remember my first “Transistor Radio”, I got in back in 1960. I could listen to the Milwaukee Braves play. I was so happy. Well, guess what, this radio brings all those memories back. Great size, fits in chest pockets as well as the back pocket of the jeans. I can hear music, talk radio and maybe after the Covid, lets baseball and football back I can hear my teams again. Wherever I go...!
customer_reviews.author: Happycamper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When the radio arrived the tuning panel was not glued to the radio. Disappointed with long distance reception. Weak stations have a high pitched squawk associated while tuning. Surprised that this is an "Amazon Choice"! When I tried to glue the tuning panel I applied too much glue. Won't tune anymore----My fault. Guess I'll have to eat this one.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: throw back to my childhood
customer_reviews.text: We love it, When you rate sound quality etc, you must remember this is a pocket transistor radio. Like what I listened to as a kid growing up. (1960's and 1970's) I bought it for several reasons, one of which was nostalgia. The fact that it maybe the only electronic receiver that i can rely on in an extended WTSHTF situation is icing on the cake. Do yourself a favor a buy one for either nostalgia or emergency preparedness or both.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Harper

customer_reviews.title: It works great, is a little smaller than I thought it ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this so we have a battery operated radio for hurricane Irma. It works great, is a little smaller than I thought it would be, glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to listen to in the morning as I get ready for work. So it was only in use for about 45 minutes, 5 days a week. It worked fine at first, but after only about 2 months it will no longer hold a station and just cuts out with static before going completely dead. Very disappointed as I expected it to last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: AM FM Portable Pocket Radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother for Christmas. She likes to lay in bed at night and listen to the radio. Radio works fine, and volume is good (she is hard of hearing). Only complaint is that it goes through batteries like crazy. She only uses the radio at night for about an hour and has had to replace the batteries twice since Christmas (28 days). Probably would not buy this brand again simply due to battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Her vision is impaired and she is quite feeble but the simplicity of this radio makes it easy for her to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 91 year old mother in law. Her vision is impaired and she is quite feeble but the simplicity of this radio makes it easy for her to use. The sound quality isn't bad either, for such a small radio. It's been difficult to tune into stations on other radios (and we have tried many), as the nursing home has a lot of interference, but this little radio has good reception. Now my mother in law can listen to NPR and feel like she's staying in touch with the world!
customer_reviews.author: Thea

customer_reviews.title: Very nice solid transistor
customer_reviews.text: Better tuning on a weak station that plays standards and swing time music which is very hard to get in Los Angeles bc mist millennials prefer hip hop, etc. Very solid compared to the plastic transistor I had and dropped many times. Update: I ordered a second one for when our electricity goes out in bad weather. Don’t need no stupid WiFi, internet connection, etc. YAY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: renewed Eyre fan

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got what I paid for... then I returned it! I got a Cheap radio that worked like a cheap radio. It’s biggest problem is/was the stations would fade in and out , mostly out. I don’t recommend this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in So. Calif

customer_reviews.title: Good for a Few Weeks Then Crap
customer_reviews.text: Had this just a few weeks and it quit working. No sound, nothing, dead. Returned and requested replacement. Have had the replacement a few weeks and this time it didn't go totally dead but again became useless as the sound is so distorted it is nothing but scratchy crackling noise. Both worked fine out of the box but took just a few weeks to become useless. Waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L.

customer_reviews.title: (Corrected FINAL results) Seemed Exceptional for its size
customer_reviews.text: Was Big sound. Quality reception. I have a few Pocket radios..this WAS the best. UPDATE! The quality lasted about a week. Now Loud STATIC now interrupts AM reception. 4/22 May be some LOCAL interference...I'll update as I figure it out. Works ok for 1st few minutes then static. UPDATE 4/23 Pulled the batteries and tossed in the drawer. Internal static across the dial. Changed Stars (*) to 1.
customer_reviews.author: Gepetto 3D

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME little radio
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME little radio! Love it! I listen to AM talk radio and reception is generally poor. But this super little thing receives my AM stations loud and clear! I will definitely purchase a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Macias

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for your emergency bag!
customer_reviews.text: The radios are new so I can't judge the battery life. We live in Alaska and went through that awful earthquake a few months ago. The electricity and cell phone transmission was out. We had no way to find out what was going on. This radio is small, simple, durable, and the perfect addition to our emergency bag. I also ordered one for each of our adult children.
customer_reviews.author: barbaram

customer_reviews.title: Great for upcoming hurricane season
customer_reviews.text: Hurricane season is really close and this is one of the things that everyone MUST have just in case. Came well packaged. It is a simple radio. It does one thing but it does it good! Reception range is amazing. Even the stations that have a lot of noise in my care are super clear on this radio . It is a great piece of equipment that everyone should own
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: nice little radio
customer_reviews.text: I am a mail carrier and sometimes like to have a radio with me, it can get quite lonesome out walking all day, lol have tried other radios and the reception was horrible, constantly hearing static which drives me nuts. Tried this one only for a couple days so far, but the reception seems to be much better, not nearly as much static as with the other radios. Will update review later on, especially come football season when the radio will be used the most.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It's a wonderful little radio.
customer_reviews.text: I grew up in a time when radios still had tubes and not transistors and living now in California, with our constant threat of earthquakes, I realized recently that our ridiculous reliance for everything on cell phones is dangerous. So I wanted a small battery powered radio and here we are with a terrific small, efficient window to the world.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Eats lithium batteries like candy
customer_reviews.text: it had an okay sound. But it broke after a few days. i came home and it didn't work. So, I changed the batteries. Same thing happened the next day. Again, I put in brand new lithium batteries. It works for a few hours. TOTAL PIECE OF GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable little radio!
customer_reviews.text: I just emailed the vendor with this message: I ordered this radio knowing that here in the San Francisco Bay Area we were facing a public safety blackout. I ordered it a day before the event. We did have the blackout. AND a brush fire broke out on the hill across the street from us that night. The radio was invaluable. The reception is great and the size made it easy to toss in my badly equipped go-bag. I really was not impressed with it out of the box, but I was totally wrong. Kudos for a great addition to my fire/earthquake go-bag!
customer_reviews.author: Loves no shipping charges!

product_meta.title: AM FM Battery Operated Portable Pocket Radio - Best Reception and Longest Lasting. AM FM Compact Transistor Radios Player Operated by 2 AA Battery, Mono Headphone Socket, by Vondior (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

Are you tired of super-complicated technology?

Are you planning a long hike, or a camping trip, and are 
concerned about losing your expensive gadgets?

Did you ever get stuck with no electricity, couldn’t charge your 
smartphone, and felt totally disconnected from the world?

Well, if that's the case, this AM/FM radio is just the solution.

Yes, you're constantly connected to your smartphone and your laptop/tablet are an indispensable part of your life, but sometimes you want total isolation from this world…

…Imagine

…you’re taking HER to a cabin in the woods

…no TV, no smartphone

…just the two of you and the radio playing “your song”

Maybe a transistor radio seems like an object that belongs to the Stone Age, but it has gained increasing popularity in the past months. Acknowledging that advanced technology has its limits and often enough has its backlash, you need an alternative.

Operating only on two AA batteries, found in every household, and any store, this pocket radio will play for weeks. Standing on a stable base, it can fill up a room with a clear sound, as it has a built-in speaker. Having a sleek and chick look, it is small enough to fit in your hand, pocket shirt or pants pocket.

It has fewer buttons than any other modern device, yet includes everything you need: on/off volume button, mono earphone jack, telescoping antenna and a carrying strap for convenience.

Surprise your loved one and purchase your classic transistor today. This gadget cuts through generations, pleasing a technologically obsessed youngster as well as a nostalgic old-school dude.

Order Now

We are committed to providing you excellence and satisfaction. 
If you are not happy with our product, we will refund 100% of your money.
feature_bullets: TAKE A BREATHER FROM TECHNOLOGY –In this digital era, you're surrounded by your smartphone, iPad or laptop, leaving you with no breathing space and no peace of mind. But sometimes all you need is to lay back with a simple transistor radio, like in the old days. With this AM/FM Portable Pocket Radio, you can unwind by tuning into your favorite music station, with zero distractions, and no annoying touch screens with endless options. Authentic pleasure in real time.

POWER OUTAGE, TRANSISTOR OUTRAGE - When power interruptions occur for long periods of time, batteries of all gadgets eventually die. It's a very stressful feeling of isolation. But with this AM/FM transistor radio, which runs on AA batteries found in every household, you can stay connected and get broadcast news in real time. Keep one in your emergency kit, it'll come in handy.

FEELS GOOD, SOUNDS BETTER - In an age of ever evolving digital electronics, it's nice to know some things never change. Radio broadcasts rock even today. This AM/FM pocket radio will take you back to your younger years without compromising sound quality. With a built-in large speaker, it can easily fill a room with your treasured songs, or favorite baseball game.

LONG LASTING ENJOYMENT–Using your devices throughout the day eats up batteries in a few hours’ time. With our AM/FM radio, your AA batteries will last for weeks. So go ahead and take it on a long trip, or give it to your son or daughter for camp. You will get great feedback upon their return.

TIMELESS GIFT IDEA – Want to score some compliments when choosing a present for your parents, grandparents, aunts or uncles? This AM/FM radio is the ultimate gadget to purchase. Simple to use, yet elegant and classy, it's sure to fill their heart with joy.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars4,837 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
